009package imagingbook.core.plugin;
010
011import java.io.File;
012import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.io.PrintStream;
015import java.nio.file.Files;
016import java.nio.file.Path;
017import java.time.LocalDateTime;
018import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.stream.Stream;
022
023import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
024import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
025import imagingbook.core.FileUtils;
026
027/**
028 * <p>
029 * The {@code main()} method of this class creates the {@code plugins.config} file 
030 * for a given plugins project, which is to be included in the associated JAR file.
031 * The execution is to be triggered during the Maven build or manually by
032 * </p>
033 * <pre>
034 * mvn exec:java -Dexec.mainClass="imagingbook.pluginutils.PluginsConfigBuilder"</pre>
035 * <p>
036 * (at the root of a plugins project).
037 * The format of the entries in {@code plugins.config} have the following structure:
038 * </p>
039 * <pre>
040 * menu-level, "plugin-name", package.classname</pre>
041 * for example:
042 * <pre>
043 * Plugins&gt;Binary&gt;Regions, "Convex Hull Demo", Binary_Regions.Convex_Hull_Demo</pre>
044 * <p>Note that, technically, menu paths may be more than 2 levels deep, but this 
045 * does not seem useful.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>
048 * Plugin classes (implementing {@link PlugIn} or {@link PlugInFilter}) may be annotated
049 * with {@link IjPluginPath} and {@link IjPluginName} to specify where in ImageJ's menu tree
050 * and by which name the plugin should be installed.
051 * This information is stored in the {@code plugins.config} file at the root of the associated project,
052 * which is automatically added to the project's output JAR file during the Maven build.
053 * Example:
054 * </p>
055 * <pre>
056 * // file MySuperPlugin.java
057 * import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
058 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjPluginName;
059 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjPluginPath;
060 * ...
061 * {@literal @}IjPluginPath("Plugins&gt;Mine")
062 * {@literal @}IjPluginName("Super Plugin")
063 * public class MySuperPlugin implements PlugInFilter {
064 *      // plugin code ...
065 * }</pre>
066 * <p>
067 * In this case, plugin {@code MySuperPlugin} should be installed in ImageJ's menu tree as
068 * <pre> Plugins &gt; Mine &gt; Super Plugin</pre>
069 * <p>
070 * By default (i.e., if no annotations are present), plugins in the default package are installed at the
071 * top-level of 'Plugins' whereas plugins inside a named package are  installed 
072 * in 'Plugins&gt;<em>package-name</em>' (see below).
073 * A {@link IjPluginPath} annotation may also be attached to a whole package
074 * in the associated {@code package-info.java} file. The following
075 * example specifies {@code Plugins>Binary Regions} as the default menu path
076 * for all plugins in package {@code Binary_Regions}:
077 * </p>
078 * <pre>
079 * // file Binary_Regions/package-info.java
080 * {@literal @}IjPluginPath("Plugins&gt;Binary Regions")
081 * package Binary_Regions;
082 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjPluginPath;</pre>
083 * <p>
084 * Individual plugins may override the menu path specified for the containing package, as summarized below:
085 * <p>
086 * <strong>Plugin <em>path</em> priority rules summary:</strong>
087 * </p>
088 * <ol>
089 * <li> Value of a {@code @IjPluginPath} annotation at class level (always overrules if exists).</li>
090 * <li> Value of a {@code @IjPluginPath} annotation at package level (if exists).</li>
091 * <li> {@link #DefaultMenuPath} + {@literal ">"} + <em>package-name</em> if the plugin is inside a named package.</li>
092 * <li> {@link #DefaultMenuPath} if the plugin is in the (unnamed) default package.</li>
093 * </ol>
094 * <p>
095 * <strong>Plugin <em>entry</em> priority rules summary:</strong>
096 * </p>
097 * <ol>
098 * <li> Value of {@link IjPluginName} annotation at class level (if exists).</li>
099 * <li> Simple name of the plugin class.</li>
100 * </ol>
101 * <p>
102 * Note that, in general, ImageJ uses the information in file {@code plugins.config} 
103 * only for plugins loaded from a JAR file!
104 * </p>
105 * 
106 * @see IjPluginPath
107 * @see IjPluginName
108 * 
109 * @author WB
110 */
111public class PluginsConfigBuilder {
112        
113        static String DefaultMenuPath = "Plugins";      // can be overridden by package or class annotation @IjPluginPath
114//      static String DefaultEntryPrefix = "B&B ";
115                        
116        static String ConfigFileName = "plugins.config";
117        static String INFO = "[INFO] ";
118        
119        static boolean VERBOSE = true;
120        static boolean ReplaceUndescoresInClassNames = true;
121        static boolean ReplaceUndescoresInPackageNames = true;
122        
123        
124        private final String artifactId;
125        private final String rootPath;
126        
127        /**
128         * Constructor (private), only called from the main() method.
129         * @param rootName the project's root (output) directory
130         * @param artifactId the project's Maven artifact id 
131         */
132        private PluginsConfigBuilder(String rootName, String artifactId) {
133                this.artifactId = artifactId;           
134                File rootDir = (rootName != null) ?
135                                new File(rootName) :
136                                new File(PluginsConfigBuilder.class.getClassLoader().getResource("").getFile());                                
137                this.rootPath = rootDir.getAbsolutePath();
138        }
139        
140        private List<Class<?>> collectPluginClasses() {
141                int n = rootPath.length();
142                File rootFile = new File(rootPath);     
143                if (!rootFile.exists()) {       // this happens when executed in a project with POM-packaging
144                        return null;
145                }
146                
147                Path start = rootFile.toPath();
148                List<Class<?>> pluginClasses = new ArrayList<>();
149                
150                try (final Stream<Path> allPaths = Files.walk(start)) {
151                        allPaths.filter(Files::isRegularFile).forEach(path -> {
152                                String pathName = path.toString();
153                                if (FileUtils.getFileExtension(pathName).equals("class")) {
154                                        String className = FileUtils.stripFileExtension(pathName);
155                                        // remove non-class part of filename:
156                                        className = className.substring(n + 1);
157                                        // convert to qualified class name:
158                                        className = className.replace(File.separatorChar, '.');
159                                        // find the associated class object (this should never fail):
160                                        Class<?> clazz = null;
161                                        try {
162                                                clazz = Class.forName(className);
163                                        } catch (final ClassNotFoundException e) {
164                                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
165                                        }
166
167                                        if (clazz != null && isIjPlugin(clazz)) {
168                                                pluginClasses.add(clazz);
169                                        }
170                                }
171                        });
172                } catch (IOException e) {
173                        //throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
174                        System.out.println("SOMETHING BAD HAPPENED: " + e.getMessage());
175                }
176                return pluginClasses;
177        }
178        
179        /**
180         * Writes plugin configuration entries to the specified stream.
181         * 
182         * @param pluginClasses a list of plugin classes
183         * @param strm the output stream (e.g., System.out)
184         */
185        private void writeEntriesToStream(List<Class<?>> pluginClasses, PrintStream strm) {
186                DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");
187                strm.println("# plugins.config file for " + artifactId + " (automatically generated)");
188                strm.println("# number of plugins: " + pluginClasses.size());
189                strm.println("# date: " + LocalDateTime.now().format(formatter));
190                
191                for (Class<?> clazz : pluginClasses) {
192                        // configure menu path:
193                        Package pkg = clazz.getPackage();
194                        String menuPath = DefaultMenuPath;
195                        if (pkg != null) {
196                                // see if 'package-info.java' contains specifies a menu path for this package
197                                // TODO: warn if package nesting is deeper than 1
198                                IjPluginPath packageMenuPathAnn = pkg.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjPluginPath.class);
199                                String pkgName = (ReplaceUndescoresInPackageNames) ? 
200                                                pkg.getName().replace('_', ' ') : pkg.getName();
201                                menuPath = (packageMenuPathAnn != null) ? 
202                                                packageMenuPathAnn.value() : DefaultMenuPath + ">" + pkgName;
203                        }
204                        // see if clazz specifies a menu path for this package (overrules package specification)
205                        IjPluginPath classMenuPathAnn = clazz.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjPluginPath.class);
206                        if (classMenuPathAnn != null) {
207                                menuPath = classMenuPathAnn.value();    
208                        }
209                        
210                        // configure menu entry:
211                        IjPluginName classMenuEntryAnn = clazz.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjPluginName.class);
212                        String className = (ReplaceUndescoresInClassNames) ?
213                                        clazz.getSimpleName().replace('_', ' ') : clazz.getSimpleName();
214                        String menuEntry = (classMenuEntryAnn != null) ? classMenuEntryAnn.value() : className;
215                        // build line for entry in config file:
216                        String configLine = String.format("%s, \"%s\", %s", menuPath, menuEntry, clazz.getCanonicalName());
217                        if (VERBOSE)
218                                System.out.println(INFO + "*** " + configLine);
219                        
220//                      strm.format("%s, \"%s\", %s\n", menuPath, menuEntry, clazz.getCanonicalName());
221                        strm.println(configLine);
222                }
223        }
224        
225        private String buildfile() {
226                List<Class<?>> pluginClasses = collectPluginClasses();
227                if  (pluginClasses == null) {
228                        System.out.println(INFO + "WARNING: no target directory (POM project?)");
229                        return null;
230                }
231                if  (pluginClasses.isEmpty()) {
232                        System.out.println(INFO + "WARNING: no plugin classes found!");
233                        return null;
234                }
235                System.out.println(INFO + "Number of plugins: " + pluginClasses.size());
236//              writeEntriesToStream(pluginClasses, System.out);
237                
238                File configFile = new File(rootPath + "/" + ConfigFileName);
239//              System.out.println("configPath = " + configFile.getAbsolutePath());
240                
241                try (PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(configFile)) {
242                        writeEntriesToStream(pluginClasses, ps);
243                } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
244                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
245                }
246                
247                return configFile.getAbsolutePath();
248        }
249        
250        /**
251         * Returns true if the specified {@link Class} object is a sub-type of
252         * {@link PlugIn} or {@link PlugInFilter}.
253         * 
254         * @param clazz a {@link Class} object
255         * @return true if a plugin type
256         */
257        private boolean isIjPlugin(Class<?> clazz) {
258                return PlugIn.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz) || PlugInFilter.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz);
259        }
260        
261        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
262        
263        /**
264         * <p>
265         * Method to be called from the command line. Builds the {@code plugins.config} file
266         * from the {@code .class} files found in the specified build directory and
267         * stores the file in the same directory.
268         * Takes two (optional) arguments:
269         * </p>
270         * <ol> 
271         * <li>The project's build (output) directory (where .class files reside).</li>
272         * <li> The project's Maven artifact id.</li>
273         * </ol>
274         * If no build directory is specified, the current directory is used.
275         * @param args {@code args[0]}: project build (output) directory, {@code args[1]}: project artefact id
276         */
277        public static void main(String[] args) {
278                String rootName   = (args.length > 0) ? args[0] : null;
279                String artifactId = (args.length > 1) ? args[1] : null;
280                System.out.println(INFO);
281                System.out.println(INFO + "--- Building plugins.config file for " + artifactId + " ---");
282                for (String arg : args) {
283                        System.out.println(INFO + "    arg = |" + arg + "|");
284                }
285                // future use to specify general plugins path from POM:
286                // using property <pluginPrefix>"Plugins&gt;B&amp;B "</pluginPrefix>
287                
288                PluginsConfigBuilder builder = new PluginsConfigBuilder(rootName, artifactId);
289                String configPath = builder.buildfile();
290                
291                if (configPath != null) {
292                        System.out.println(INFO + "Config file written: " + configPath);
293                }
294                else {
295                        System.out.println(INFO + "No config file written");
296                }
297        }
298
